thread.title: Raiders ride stingy defense to Homecoming win over West Chester, 27-11
thread.title_full: Raiders ride stingy defense to Homecoming win over West Chester, 27-11

author: Courtesy of SU Sports Information
title: Raiders ride stingy defense to Homecoming win over West Chester, 27-11
text:
SUBMITTED PHOTO SU Homecoming VFW MVPs 
Shippensburg VFW Post 6168 presented MVP awards after the Shippensburg University Homecoming football game. Quarterback Ryan Zapoticky (5) received the Offensive MVP Award and linebacker Cortlin Dell (45) received the Defensive MVP Award for their performance in SU’s 27-11 win over West Chester. John Sheaffer from the Shippensburg VFW, pictured alongside SU head coach Mark Maciejewski, presented the awards for the 24th consecutive year. PHOTO BY DARYL BUGHMAN Pyle 
Of the Raiders’ 44 runs on the day, 15 went to junior Justin Pyle (pictured), who led the team with 96 yards. PHOTO BY BILL SLATTERY Forney 
Brady Forney (center) celebrates with teammates Justin Pyle (22) and Quran Kent (3) after his 41-yard touchdown reception in the third quarter against West Chester. PHOTO BY BILL SLATTERY Burkey 
DJ Burkey (6) and Cortlin Dell (45) take down West Chester’s Jarel Elder before the Homecoming Game crowd at Seth Grove Stadium. Posted: Tuesday, October 20, 2015 6:00 am Raiders ride stingy defense to Homecoming win over West Chester, 27-11 Courtesy of SU Sports Information ShipNC.com | 0 comments 
The Shippensburg University football team forced four turnovers and made timely offensive plays Saturday on Homecoming, posting an inspired 27-11 victory over longtime nemesis West Chester in front of a capacity crowd at a breezy and chilly SU Student Association Field at Seth Grove Stadium. 
The 11 points allowed by Shippensburg (5-2, 3-1 PSAC East) are the fewest surrendered to West Chester (4-3, 3-1) in a matchup of the two teams since 1931 – a game that ended in a 0-0 tie. The Red Raiders picked off three West Chester passes and forced a fumble to score just their third win over the Golden Rams in the last 12 meetings. kAm$& H2D @FE82:?65 :?
